mprMepElementsBender.FullDescription: Plugin allows you to create a bypass of MEP elements without constantly selecting them from the plugin window: for this, you first need to select the intersected elements (i.e. those elements that need to be bypassed), and then just select the necessary elements in the model. In this case, the plugin will automatically add items to the list of processed
mprMepElementsBender.m21: No elements to bypass have been selected!
mprMepElementsBender.m23: An error occurred while creating an element bend. It is likely that the entered offset and angle do not allow bending.
mprMepElementsBender.m25: Choose the option for further work, taking into account the applied changes:
mprMepElementsBender.m31: Select the intersecting elements to be bent
mprMepElementsBender.tp5: Add filters for element categories that will bend
mprMepElementsBender.tp6: Conditions for filters: AND – for an element to be selected, it needs to match all filters, OR – it is enough to match one of the filters
mprMepElementsBender.tp8: Add filters for element categories that will be bended
mprMepElementsBender.e1: Failed to create elbow fitting. Check the existence of the necessary families in the project and the trace settings of the elements to be processed

mprMEPConnect.Description: Collection of plugins for automation of engineering systems connections
mprMEPConnect.Description1: Batch connection of diffusers to ducts
mprMEPConnect.Description2: Connect two connectors (or MEP curves) by rotating and moving the first selected one
mprMEPConnect.Description3: Batch connection of straight pipes, ducts, wires, cable trays or conduits lying in one straight line
mprMEPConnect.Description4: Breaks the connection between the nearest connected connector of the selected MEP element and the adjacent element
mprMEPConnect.msg1: Select ducts and diffusers to be connected to them
mprMEPConnect.msg3: No diffusers selected! Only diffusers that have one unconnected connector oriented along the Z axis are allowed for processing
mprMEPConnect.msg5: Select the element to connect to
mprMEPConnect.msg6: Select straight pipes, ducts, wires, cable trays or conduits
mprMEPConnect.t1: Type of branch to be created:
mprMEPConnect.t2: Create a flexible connection between diffuser and branch
mprMEPConnect.err1: Vertical offset between diffuser and duct is not enough to create a connection
mprMEPConnect.err2: The distance between the diffuser and the duct is less than the specified length of the flexible connection
mprMEPConnect.err5: Check the routing preferences for the specified duct types
mprMEPConnect.err9: Selected element has no free connectors
mprMEPConnect.err10: The selected elements have a connector of different shapes
mprMEPConnect.err11: The selected elements have a connector of different sizes
mprMEPConnect.err12: The selected elements have a connector of different system types
mprMEPConnect.err13: The selected element has no connected connectors

mprMEPRotate.Description: A collection of plugins for rotating parts of MEP systems
mprMEPRotate.Description1: Rotation of fittings or parts of MEP systems
mprMEPRotate.Description2: Rotation of fittings or parts of MEP systems in the direction of the MEP curve
mprMEPRotate.Description3: Turning the cable tray on its edge
mprMEPRotate.t8: Select the nearest element to the connector around which you want to rotate
mprMEPRotate.t9: Select the reference MEP curve element
mprMEPRotate.msg2: It's impossible to turn in that direction

mprMEPAlign.Description: A collection of plugins for aligning MEP curves
mprMEPAlign.Description2: Setting the distance between MEP curves
mprMEPAlign.msg1: Selected MEP curves are not parallel
mprMEPAlign.msg6: Selected MEP curves do not have the same slope
mprMEPAlign.msg7: Less than two MEP curves selected
mprMEPAlign.t1: Select the reference MEP curve for alignment
mprMEPAlign.t2: Select the MEP curve to be aligned
mprMEPAlign.t15: Select the MEP element to be aligned

mprMEPCopy.Description: A collection of plugins for copying MEP elements
mprMEPCopy.Description1: Copying MEP elements with alignment to selected levels
mprMEPCopy.Description2: Copying MEP elements vertically by distance
mprMEPCopy.Description3: Copying MEP elements in direction by distance
mprMEPCopy.msg3: Failed to identify a base level of elements
mprMEPCopy.msg4: Specify a point on the MEP curve to select a direction
mprMEPCopy.t7:
If both "Count" and "Distance" options are enabled, the selected elements will be copied the specified number of times at the defined distance in the chosen direction.
If only the "Count" option is enabled, only elements connected to MEP curves whose direction matches the selected direction will be copied. Copying will be performed the specified number of times, evenly spaced until reaching the end of the MEP curve.
If only the "Distance" option is enabled, only elements connected to MEP curves whose direction matches the selected direction will be copied. Copying will be performed repeatedly at the specified distance as long as the elements can connect to the MEP curves.

mprMEPSplit.Description: MEP curve splits by levels, reference planes or defined parameters
mprMEPSplit.t1: Displacement of connecting fittings (up or down)
mprMEPSplit.t13: Highlight and show the elements in the model
mprMEPSplit.t22: No MEP separation configurations found in the specified file
mprMEPSplit.t23: The list of configurations is not empty! Select action
